n8n.title: n8n Package - Aisello
n8n.subtitle: Official community nodes package for n8n enabling integration with Aisello.
n8n.packageInfo: The n8n-nodes-aisello package contains 3 nodes with over 80 operations covering posts, brands, AI content generation, databases and more.
n8n.overviewDescription: n8n-nodes-aisello is a community nodes package for the n8n platform that provides full integration with the Aisello API. You can automate content creation, brand management, post publishing and database operations - all without writing code.

installation.title: Installation
installation.description: You can install the package in three ways:
installation.communityStep1: In n8n, go to Settings > Community Nodes
installation.npmDescription: Install the package in the n8n nodes directory:
installation.dockerDescription: If n8n runs in Docker, install the package inside the container:

credentials.title: Credentials setup
credentials.description: To allow nodes to communicate with the API, you need to configure credentials in n8n:
credentials.step1: Log into Aisello and go to Settings > API Tokens
credentials.step2: Create a new Personal Access Token
credentials.step3: In n8n, create a new Aisello API credential
credentials.step4: Paste the token and optionally change the API URL (default: https://aisello.com)
credentials.urlDescription: Base URL of the Aisello instance (default: https://aisello.com)

aiselloNode.title: Aisello Node
aiselloNode.summary: Main node for managing personal brand automation.
aiselloNode.description: Main node covering 14 resources: posts, brands, automation, content plans, calendar, boards, media, notifications and more. All ID fields have dynamic dropdowns that fetch data from the API.

databaseNode.title: Aisello Database Node
databaseNode.summary: Airtable-like database operations with cascading dropdowns.
databaseNode.description: Database operations node: bases, tables, fields, rows, cells and attachments. Dropdowns work in a cascading fashion - select a base and the tables will load automatically.

triggerNode.title: Aisello Trigger Node
triggerNode.summary: Webhook trigger receiving publishing result callbacks.
triggerNode.description: A trigger (webhook) node that receives callbacks from Aisello when posts are published. Allows reacting to events in real time.
triggerNode.step1: Add an Aisello Trigger node to your workflow
triggerNode.step2: Optionally set a Webhook Secret for security
triggerNode.step4: Paste the URL in Aisello automation settings
triggerNode.secretDescription: You can optionally set a secret that will be validated via the X-Webhook-Secret header. If the secret doesn't match, the webhook returns 401 Unauthorized.

generationTriggers.title: Generation Triggers
generationTriggers.description: Special trigger nodes for asynchronous content generation and publishing. Allows building custom workflows with any AI models.

asyncFlow.title: Async data flow
asyncFlow.description: The trigger immediately returns HTTP 202 (Accepted), and the workflow continues processing in the background. When finished, the Aisello Respond node sends results back to callback_url.

textTrigger.title: Aisello Text Generation Trigger
textTrigger.description: Starts the workflow when Aisello requests text generation for a post. Connect with AI nodes (OpenAI, Claude) and finish with Aisello Respond node.

imageTrigger.title: Aisello Image Generation Trigger
imageTrigger.description: Starts the workflow when Aisello requests image generation. Connect with AI nodes (DALL-E, Stable Diffusion) and finish with Aisello Respond node.

publishTrigger.title: Aisello Publish Trigger
publishTrigger.description: Starts the workflow when Aisello sends a post for publishing. Handle publishing your own way (platform API, Zapier) and finish with Aisello Respond node.

respondNode.title: Aisello Respond
respondNode.description: Node for sending processing results back to Aisello. Automatically posts data to the callback_url received from the trigger.

setup.title: Setup
setup.step1: Create a workflow in n8n with the appropriate trigger (Text/Image/Publish)
setup.step3: End the workflow with Aisello Respond node
setup.step4: Copy the webhook URL and paste it in brand automation settings (text_generation_url / image_generation_url / publish_url)

automationApi.title: Automation (Webhooks)
automationApi.howItWorksDescription: The automation system uses configurable webhooks per brand. When you trigger "Generate Text" or "Generate Image" from the UI (or API), the system sends a POST request to your configured webhook URL (e.g. n8n) with post data. Your webhook processes the data and returns the result. The system then updates the post automatically.

createPost.title: Create a Post (starting point)
createPost.description: Before generating content or images, you need to create a post with a topic idea. You can create it via the Calendar UI or via API. The main_caption is optional - you can leave it empty and generate the content later using webhooks.
createPost.titleField: title (required) - post topic / idea, e.g. "5 AI trends in marketing"
createPost.captionField: main_caption (optional) - initial content, can be empty if you plan to generate it via webhook
createPost.scheduledField: scheduled_at (optional) - planned publish date in ISO 8601 format
createPost.platformsField: platforms (optional) - array of platforms: facebook, instagram, youtube
createPost.note: The post is created with status "draft". Then use the automation endpoints to generate text, image, approve and publish.
createPost.exampleTitle: Example: create post with just a topic

howItWorksSteps.step1: Create a post with a topic idea (via Calendar UI or POST /api/v1/posts)
howItWorksSteps.step2: Configure webhook URLs in brand automation settings
howItWorksSteps.step3: Trigger generation (Generate Text / Generate Image) via UI or API
howItWorksSteps.step4: System sends POST with post data + brand context to your webhook
howItWorksSteps.step5: Your webhook (n8n) processes and returns result
howItWorksSteps.step6: System updates the post with returned content / image

automationApi.webhookReferenceDescription: Each webhook type receives the same base payload (post data + brand context) and must return a specific JSON response. Below is a detailed description of what each webhook receives and what it must return.

textGenerationWebhook.title: Text Generation Webhook
textGenerationWebhook.description: Called when user clicks "Generate Text" in the UI or calls the API. The system sends full post data with brand context and prompt. Your webhook should generate post content (caption) and optionally a new title.
textGenerationWebhook.fallbackNote: If no webhook URL is configured, the system automatically falls back to built-in AI (OpenAI) using the brand context.
textGenerationWebhook.keyField1: prompt - default prompt from webhook settings (or override from request)
textGenerationWebhook.keyField3: brand_context - full brand info (tone, audience, pillars, etc.)
textGenerationWebhook.returnField2: caption - generated post content text (saved to main_caption)
textGenerationWebhook.returnField3: title - (optional) new title for the post

imageGenerationWebhook.title: Image Generation Webhook
imageGenerationWebhook.description: Called when user clicks "Generate Image" in the UI or calls the API. The system sends full post data including the current content. Your webhook should generate an actual image (e.g. via DALL-E, Midjourney, Stable Diffusion) and return it as base64. The image is automatically saved as media attachment on the post.
imageGenerationWebhook.fallbackNote: No fallback - returns error if no webhook URL is configured.
imageGenerationWebhook.keyField2: main_caption - current post content (use it to generate a matching image)
imageGenerationWebhook.keyField3: brand_context - full brand info (use for style/branding)
imageGenerationWebhook.returnField2: image_base64 - the generated image as base64 string (supports data URI prefix or raw base64). Formats: PNG, JPG, WebP, GIF
imageGenerationWebhook.returnField3: filename - (optional) original filename for the image
imageGenerationWebhook.returnField4: image_prompt - (optional) text description of the image, saved alongside

publishWebhook.title: Publish Webhook
publishWebhook.description: Called when user clicks "Publish" in the UI or calls the API. Post must be in approved or scheduled status. The system sends the complete post with content, image description, schedule date and brand context. Your webhook should use this data to publish the post to external platforms (Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, etc.).
publishWebhook.fallbackNote: No fallback - returns error if no webhook URL is configured.
publishWebhook.keyField1: main_caption - final post content to publish
publishWebhook.keyField2: image_prompt - image description for generating/attaching visuals
publishWebhook.keyField3: scheduled_at - planned publish date (ISO 8601) or null for immediate
publishWebhook.keyField5: brand_context.enabled_platforms - list of platforms to publish to
publishWebhook.returnField2: message - status message (e.g. "Published to Facebook and Instagram")

onApproveWebhook.title: On Approve Webhook
onApproveWebhook.description: Called automatically when a post is approved (via UI or API). Fire-and-forget - the system does not wait for a response and failures are logged silently. Use this to trigger follow-up workflows (e.g. auto-generate images, schedule publishing, send notifications).
onApproveWebhook.fallbackNote: If no webhook URL is configured, nothing happens (skipped silently).
onApproveWebhook.returnNote: Response is ignored (fire-and-forget). Recommended to return success: true for logging.

automationApi.configureSettings: Configure webhook URLs and default prompts for a brand. All fields are optional - only set the webhooks you need.
automationApi.outboundPayloadDescription: Every webhook call sends this JSON body to your endpoint:

generateText.description: Trigger text generation for a post. Calls the text_generation_url webhook. If no webhook is configured, falls back to built-in AI generation using the brand context. The returned caption and title are automatically saved to the post.
generateText.promptParam: Override the default prompt for this request

generateImagePrompt.description: Trigger image generation for a post. Calls the image_generation_url webhook. No fallback - returns error if no webhook is configured. The webhook should return the image as base64 in the image_base64 field. The image is automatically saved as a media attachment on the post.

webhookPublish.description: Publish a post via the configured publish_url webhook. Post must be in approved or scheduled status. Returns error if no publish webhook is configured.

automationApi.bulkGenerateText: Generate text for multiple posts at once (max 20). Calls the text generation webhook for each post sequentially.
automationApi.bulkGenerateImagePrompt: Generate images for multiple posts at once (max 20). Calls the image generation webhook for each post sequentially. Each webhook response should return the image as base64.
automationApi.automationList: List posts for the automation table view. Supports filtering by brand, status, and search.

n8nApproveExample.note: Note: on_approve is fire-and-forget. Failures are logged but won't block the approval.
